7.1.2. Arbitrarily sampled grid-controlled-variable¶

class csdfpy.controlled_variables._arbitrarilySampledGridDimension(_coordinates, _reference_offset=None, _origin_offset=None, _quantity=None, _reverse=False, _label='', _period=None, _made_dimensionless=False, _sampling_type='grid', _non_quantitative=False, _reciprocal_reference_offset=None, _reciprocal_origin_offset=None, _reciprocal_quantity=None, _reciprocal_reverse=False, _reciprocal_label='', _reciprocal_period=None, _reciprocal_made_dimensionless=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Attributes Summary

Return type:Quantity instance
origin_offset
Return type:Quantity instance

Attributes Documentation

coordinates¶
Return type:Quantity instance

The attribute returns the controlled variable coordinates along the dimension. The order of these coordinates depends on the value of the reverse attribute of the class.

reference_offset¶
Return type:Quantity instance
Assign type:string

The attribute returns the reference offset along the dimension. This attribute can also be used to update the reference offset along the grid dimension. When assigning a value, the dimensionality of the value must be consistent with other members specifying the dimension. For example, a reference_offset of “-10 cm”.

origin_offset¶
Return type:Quantity instance
Assign type:string

The attribute returns the origin offset along the dimension. This attribute can also be used to update the orgin offset along this dimension. When assigning a value, the dimensionality of the value must be consistent with other members specifying the dimension. For example, a origin_offset of “1.0 m”.

quantity¶
Return type:string
Assign type:string

The attribute returns the quantity name associated with the dimension. When assigning a value, this attribute updates the previous value. The quantity name must be consistent with other physical quantities specifying the dimension. For example, the quantity name, “length”.

reverse¶
Role:reverse
Return type:boolean
Assign type:boolean

The attribute returns a boolean specifying the mapping of the controlled variable coordinates, associated with the dimension, to the grid indices. This attribute value can be updated.

label¶
Return type:string
Assign type:string

The attribute returns the label associated with the dimension. When assigning a value, this attribute updates the previous value. For example, a label of “distance”.

period¶
Return type:Quantity instance
Assign type:string

The attribute returns the period of the dimension. When assigned a value, this attribute updates the previous value. For example, a period of “1 cm”.

quantity
Return type:string
Assign type:string

The attribute returns the quantity name associated with the dimension. When assigning a value, this attribute updates the previous value. The quantity name must be consistent with other physical quantities specifying the dimension. For example, the quantity name, “length”.

Methods Summary

to(unit) Converts the unit of the controlled variables coordinates to unit.

Method Documentation

to(unit)[source]¶

Converts the unit of the controlled variables coordinates to unit. This method wraps the to method from the Quantity class. The methods returns a Quantity object.
